snippet: Under a revised version of a rule proposed by the government, companies drilling on public lands would have to identify the chemicals used, but not until after drilling was completed.
abstract: Obama administration issues proposed rules governing hydraulic fracturing for oil and gas on public lands that will for the first time require disclosure of chemicals used in the process, but only after drilling has been completed.
lead_paragraph: Under a revised version of a rule proposed by the government, companies drilling on public lands would have to identify the chemicals used, but not until after drilling was completed.

headline.seo: New Fracking Rule Is Issued by Obama Administration
headline.main: New Proposal on Fracking Gives Ground to Industry
headline.print_headline: New Rule Requires Disclosure of Drilling Chemicals, but Only After Their Use
